question.text: Which of the following statements is CORRECT?

options.text: Propionibacterium shermanii is involved in the formation of Swiss cheese.
Germinating barley seeds are used in the preparation of Toddy.
Secondary treatment of sewage involves the vigorous growth of anaerobic microbes into flocs.

solution.text:
Swiss cheese has large holes in it due to carbon dioxide formation by the activity of bacteria Propionibacteriumsharmanii.
Spirulina is used as a source of single cell protein.
Secondary treatment of sewage involves the vigorous growth of aerobic microbes in to flocs.
‘Toddy’, a traditional drink of some parts of southern India is made by fermenting sap from palms.
